heroIntro: This exceptional 4-bedroom villa in the prestigious Mascarat neighbourhood of Calpe represents a sophisticated investment for discerning buyers seeking premium Costa Blanca living. Located in one of the region's most exclusive enclaves, this residence offers refined architecture and superior build quality, priced at €2,200,000—a compelling proposition given its premium specification comes at 20% less than comparable properties in Jávea. The villa's 268-square-metre built area is carefully designed across a 200-square-metre plot, maximising both privacy and comfort for those who appreciate the finer aspects of Mediterranean living. With four generous bedrooms and three full bathrooms, this home accommodates both family retreats and sophisticated entertaining. The property demonstrates strong investment potential in a market experiencing 7% year-on-year growth, whilst offering excellent rental yields of approximately €1,000 per week during peak season. For luxury buyers, this represents an opportunity to acquire premium Costa Blanca real estate without the premium Jávea price tag, combining exclusivity with outstanding value.
areaSection: Mascarat is Calpe's most distinguished residential quarter, positioned on the northern coastline between the dramatic Peñón de Ifach and pristine Mediterranean beaches. This established neighbourhood commands premium valuations due to its elevated location providing panoramic coastal vistas, combined with mature landscaping and a strong sense of community. Calpe itself benefits from a year-round Mediterranean climate with approximately 300 days of sunshine, temperate winters, and warm summers moderated by sea breezes. The town has evolved from a fishing village into a cosmopolitan destination whilst retaining authentic Spanish character. Geography plays a significant role in Calpe's appeal—the iconic Peñón landmark creates a stunning natural focal point, the coastline features multiple Blue Flag beaches, and the hinterland offers both pine-covered hills and cultivated agricultural valleys. The area's elevation provides natural cooling and protection from excessive summer heat, whilst winter temperatures rarely drop below 10°C.
lifestyleSection: Living in Mascarat, Calpe offers a refined Mediterranean lifestyle tailored to those seeking both sophistication and substance. The neighbourhood attracts an international community of predominantly British and German residents who have established excellent schools, healthcare facilities, and cultural institutions—English is widely spoken throughout the area. Daily life revolves around exceptional beaches including the Blue Flag Arenal-Bol just moments away, world-class golf at Club de Golf Ifach adjacent to the property, and an thriving social scene centred around yacht clubs and exclusive restaurants. The weekly markets provide access to fresh local produce, whilst supermarket chains and fine dining establishments cater to every requirement. Healthcare access is comprehensive with Centro de Salud Calp nearby, multiple private clinics staffed with English-speaking doctors, and major hospitals within 30 minutes. The expat community creates a welcoming environment without isolation from authentic Spanish culture—residents enjoy both international amenities and genuine local traditions. This balanced lifestyle appeals to executives, entrepreneurs, and established families seeking cosmopolitan living within a secure, well-maintained environment.
investmentSection: This villa represents a strategic investment within an appreciating Costa Blanca market currently experiencing 7% year-on-year growth. At €8,209 per square metre, the property offers significant value advantage compared to Jávea's equivalent properties, whilst commanding premium positioning above Calpe's area average of €2,600 per square metre—reflecting its exclusive Mascarat location and superior specification. Rental yields demonstrate strong performance with typical 7-night seasonal lettings achieving €1,000, providing consistent returns during peak periods and offsetting ownership costs. The property's four-bedroom configuration appeals to both family users and the lucrative holiday rental market, particularly attractive to luxury short-term rental platforms. Market fundamentals remain robust, supported by continued demand from international buyers, infrastructure improvements including the forthcoming tram connection, and Calpe's evolution as a premier destination. The combination of capital appreciation potential, rental income generation, and personal use flexibility creates a compelling investment narrative for sophisticated buyers.
conclusion: This exceptional villa in Mascarat represents a rare opportunity to acquire premium Costa Blanca property combining exclusivity, investment potential, and Mediterranean lifestyle excellence. The four-bedroom residence offers flexible living configurations suitable for family retreat, guest accommodation, or professional use, whilst generating substantial rental income. Located within Calpe's most prestigious neighbourhood yet priced significantly below equivalent Jávea properties, the villa delivers compelling value for sophisticated international buyers. The established expatriate community, world-class amenities, and strong market fundamentals create both lifestyle and financial benefits. For discerning buyers seeking sophisticated Mediterranean living without compromise on quality or location, this property merits detailed consideration. healthcare.text: Healthcare access in Calpe meets international standards with multiple facilities catering to English-speaking residents. Centro de Salud Calp provides primary care services immediately accessible to Mascarat residents, whilst private clinics staffed with English-speaking medical professionals operate throughout the town. Hospital de Dénia, located 30 minutes south, provides comprehensive emergency and specialised medical services. The region benefits from Spain's excellent healthcare system combined with private clinic options preferred by expatriate residents. Medical tourism and preventive care services attract international visitors, ensuring facilities remain contemporary. Pharmaceutical services are readily available with multiple pharmacies throughout Calpe, and helicopter emergency evacuation services operate from Alicante.

Mas y Mas shopping centre provides additional retail options including fashion, homeware, and dining establishments. For personal travel, the motorway network provides rapid access throughout the Costa Blanca, whilst local roads facilitate exploration of hinterland villages and attractions. Parking availability remains abundant, supporting car-based lifestyle preferences common among residents.
